mainmatter.p:
A locale X is called spectral if it satisfies the following two conditions.
Every open of X is expressible as a join of compact opens of X.
The set of compact elements of X forms a sub-meet-semilattice of the frame \mathcal{O} ( X ). Notes:
Defined in Paragraph 3.2 of Stone Spaces. He calls this notion “coherent” locale.
